poem:
**Winter Advisory**

Turn the dial, coax warmth from cold iron,  
a fortress of fleece and flannel.  
Snow parades past windowpanes,  
a swirling ballet of frozen grace.  
Streeting says "stay home, cocooned,"  
as winter whispers through skeleton trees,  
cutting deeper than budgeted heat.  
The heart sputters, frugal flame—  
a penny pinched, a shiver shared.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK weather live: country braces for snow and freezing rain as temperatures fall 8.05am GMT The health secretary, Wes Streeting, told the BBC that “it is definitely a weekend to turn the heating on” as he defended the government’s cut to winter fuel payments, which he said had been protected for the “poorest pensioners”. “This is a weekend to wrap up and keep warm, to take sensible precautions about going out and about,” he said.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
